meanings.sent1: Wearing a helmet precludes head injuries during biking.
meanings.sent2: Rain precludes our picnic in the park.
meanings.sent3: His fear of spiders precludes him from entering the basement.
meanings.sent4: The locked gate precludes any unauthorized access to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The early morning fog precludes a clear view of the sunrise.

meanings.sent1: Running out of gas precludes us from reaching the destination.
meanings.sent2: The heavy snowfall precludes driving on the mountain roads.
meanings.sent3: Her strict diet precludes her from enjoying desserts.
meanings.sent4: The broken bridge precludes any further travel along the river.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise precludes a peaceful night's sleep.

meanings.sent1: His lack of experience precludes him from the job opportunity.
meanings.sent2: The conflicting schedules preclude us from attending both events.
meanings.sent3: The limited budget precludes a luxurious vacation this year.
meanings.sent4: The strict rules preclude any exceptions to the policy.
meanings.sent5: The closed sign precludes any customers from entering the store.
